Description: Table for landscape design, terrace gardens, public parks, road medians, and commercial or residential complexes.
Usage: Residential Homes Gardens, balconies, and terraces
Apartments & Societies Entry gates, common areas.
Commercial Spaces Malls, office campuses, hotels.

Description: An RCC Bench is a Reinforced Cement Concrete seating structure, commonly used in parks, public spaces,
gardens, campuses, bus stops, and residential complexes. These benches are known for their durability,
weather resistance, and low maintenance, making them ideal for outdoor use.
Usage: Public Parks & Gardens Standard seating areas.
Bus Stops Long-lasting public waiting seats
Schools & Campuses Durable seating for open areas

Description: RCC Hume Pipes (also known as Reinforced Concrete Cement pipes) are cylindrical, precast concrete pipes
reinforced with steel, used primarily for underground drainage, sewerage, stormwater, culverts, and
irrigation systems. They are known for high strength, long life, and resistance to heavy loads.
Usage: Urban Infrastructure Drainage systems beneath roads and streets.
Roads & Railways Culverts and cross drains
Industrial Zones Large-scale water and waste disposal.

Description: An RCC Dome (Reinforced Cement Concrete Dome) is a curved, hemispherical concrete structure reinforced
with steel bars, used in architectural, religious, institutional, and structural applications. RCC domes are
known for their aesthetic appeal, structural efficiency, and ability to span large areas without columns.
Usage: Temples, Mosques, Churches As religious or sacred roof forms
Government Buildings Parliament domes, courts, assembly halls
Public Infrastructure Planetariums, museums, libraries

Description: RCC Concrete Blocks are precast solid or hollow units made from Reinforced Cement Concrete, used in
construction of load-bearing walls, retaining walls, boundary walls, compound walls, and even pavement
barriers. These blocks combine the compressive strength of concrete with the tensile reinforcement of
steel, making them suitable for heavy-duty, structural applications
Usage: Industrial Zones High-stress partition or enclosure walls
Retaining Structures Basement walls, backfill support.
Highway Infrastructure Barriers, edging, or boundary block walls
Government/Defence Facilities Impact-resistant wall blocks.

Description: RCC Grass Pavers are perforated precast concrete blocks designed to allow grass or ground cover to grow
through openings, combining pavement strength with green aesthetics. These are also known as
permeable pavers, green pavers, or eco-grid pavers, and are commonly used for eco-friendly landscaping,
parking areas, and stormwater management systems.
Usage: Residential Lawns & Gardens Decorative yet functional walking/driving areas
Public Parks Green walkways, service paths.
Parking Lots Eco-parking for malls, offices, hotels.
Pathways & Driveways Especially where natural drainage is desired.

Description: RCC Concrete Hollow Blocks are precast masonry units made from reinforced cement concrete with
hollow cores. These blocks are engineered for strength, durability, and thermal efficiency, and are widely
used in load-bearing walls, boundary walls, foundations, and retaining structures where both strength and
reduced weight are needed.
Usage: Residential Buildings Structural and non-structural walls.
Industrial Warehouses Durable walls that resist impact and moisture.
School & Hospital Construction Cost-effective and rapid walling system.
Infrastructure Projects Cabins, utility walls, and enclosures.

Description: RCC Interlocking Bricks are precast cement concrete blocks engineered with a tongue-and-groove
(interlocking) design that fits bricks tightly together without mortar. When reinforced with steel (RCC), they
gain additional strength, making them ideal for structural walls, retaining walls, boundary walls, and even
pavements or slope protection.
Usage: Low-Cost Housing Fast construction with structural integrity
Retaining Walls Gravity-based or reinforced interlocking walls.
Perimeter & Boundary Walls Secure and uniform appearance
Garden Walls Decorative yet strong fences.

Description: An RCC Table is a precast concrete furniture piece made from Reinforced Cement Concrete, designed for
durability, weather resistance, and low maintenance. These tables are ideal for outdoor public spaces,
parks, gardens, schools, industrial canteens, and government or municipal zones where robust and
tamper-proof furniture is needed.
Usage: Public Parks Paired with benches for family gatherings.
Educational Campuses Study or lunch tables in outdoor areas.
Industrial Zones Canteen tables for workers.
Resorts & Hotels Outdoor garden seating.

Description: GRC Pillar Columns are architectural vertical elements made using Glassfiber Reinforced Concrete (GRC) – a
lightweight, durable, and moldable composite material. GRC pillars are widely used in both structural
cladding and decorative applications, offering aesthetic flexibility with classical or modern styles.
Usage: Residential Villas Porch, balcony, entrance column
Temples & Mosques Decorative traditional-style pillars
Hotels & Resorts Landscape and reception columns

Description: GRC Grills (Glassfiber Reinforced Concrete grills) are lightweight, ornamental ventilation or façade
elements made from GRC composite. These are used for decorative purposes, privacy screens, sunshades,
and ventilation panels, offering the look of traditional stone or jali (lattice) work while being far lighter, cost-
effective, and customizable
Usage: Residential Villas Staircases, balconies, windows
Temples & Mosques Traditional jali patterns
Hotels & Resorts Partition screens, courtyard accents
Commercial Buildings Façade cladding, service shaft covers

Description: A GRC Frame is a decorative or architectural frame made from Glassfiber Reinforced Concrete (GRC),
designed to surround doors, windows, niches, panels, mirrors, or even as façade borders. GRC frames
replicate the look of stone, wood, or molded plaster, but with lightweight
durable, and weather-resistant properties.
Usage: Residential Villas Around windows, entry doors, balcony arches
Hotels & Resorts Mirror frames, lobby wall insets, corridor panels
Temples, Mosques & Churches Carved traditional surrounds and niche frame
Cultural Centers Heritage-style wall framing and ornamentation

Description: A GRC Capital is the top decorative portion of a column or pillar made from Glassfiber Reinforced Concrete
(GRC). It crowns the column shaft and enhances the aesthetic appeal and architectural style—from classical
(Corinthian, Ionic, Doric) to modern minimalistic forms. GRC allows lightweight, durable, and highly detailed
molding, making it ideal for both heritage restorations and contemporary facades.
Usage: Villas & Bungalows Front porch and balcony columns
Temples & Mosques Religious architecture with classical details
Hotels & Resorts Grand entrance lobbies and pavilions
Government Buildings Heritage facades and porticos

Description: A GRC Cornice is a decorative horizontal molding that crowns a building or structure, made using
Glassfiber Reinforced Concrete (GRC). It is designed to enhance the facade, hide roof joints, and provide
visual definition between architectural levels (like rooflines, parapets, and floor bands).
GRC allows for lightweight, intricately detailed, weatherproof cornices, replicating traditional stone or plaster styles without the structural burden.
Religious domes, minarets, and arches
Usage: Villas & Bungalows Roof lines, balconies, window tops
Temples, Mosques & Churches Religious domes, minarets, and arches
Hotels & Resorts Elegant facades and porticos

Description: A GRC Baluster is a decorative and structural element made from Glassfiber Reinforced Concrete, used as
the vertical post in a balustrade system (which includes the handrail, base rail, and balusters). GRC balusters
offer the classical look of carved stone or wood with lightweight
weather-resistant, and cost-effective advantages.
Usage: Residential Balconies, staircases, verandahs, terraces
Hotels & Resorts Poolside railings, terrace balustrades
Temples & Mosques Surrounding domes, corridors, and steps
Public Buildings Garden railings, entry porches, gazebos

Description: A GRC Mural is a decorative wall art panel or relief sculpture made from Glassfiber Reinforced Concrete
(GRC). These murals are used to enhance aesthetics, convey cultural or thematic messages, and add visual
depth to interior or exterior surfaces. GRC allows intricate carving, 3D textures, and large-format designs
that are lightweight, weatherproof, and long-lasting
Usage: Temples & Mosques Mythological or spiritual stories in relief
Hotels & Resorts Nature, tropical, or local cultural scenes
Public Parks Educational or environmental storytelling
Private Villas Custom designs on boundary walls or lounges

Description: A GRC 3D Wall Panel is a textured architectural cladding element made of Glassfiber Reinforced Concrete
(GRC), designed to give walls a three-dimensional, sculptural appearance. These panels are used to
enhance visual depth, play with shadow and light,
and add modern or classic character to both interior and exterior spaces.
Usage: Building Facades Feature elevation panels or screen walls
Hotel Lobbies & Malls Reception, corridor, or display walls
Residential Interiors Living room, stair wall, bedroom backdrops
Office & Commercial Spaces Brand walls, conference rooms

Description: A Precast Concrete Column is a vertical structural member manufactured off-site in a controlled factory
environment and then transported to the construction site for installation. These columns are widely used in
both residential, commercial, industrial, and infrastructure projects due to their speed of construction
uniform quality, and high load-bearing capacity
Usage: Commercial Buildings Columns for multi-story frames
Industrial Sheds Heavy-duty RCC columns with corbels for crane beams
Residential Villas Decorative or structural columns
Bridges & Flyovers Large precast piers or support columns

Description: A Precast Hollow Core Slab (HCS) is a prestressed concrete floor or roof slab with continuous voids (cores)
running through its length. These voids reduce the self-weight of the slab, improve structural efficiency, and
allow for quick and economical construction of flooring systems in buildings.
Usage: High-Rise Buildings Floors in residential and commercial towers
Schools / Hospitals Fast installation and durable flooring
Malls & Office Spaces Long spans, flat soffits for easy services
Industrial Buildings Roof and mezzanine slabs

Description: Precast concrete walls are factory-made concrete wall panels used in building construction and
infrastructure. These walls are manufactured under controlled conditions, then transported to the site and
installed using cranes. They offer a fast, strong, and durable solution for creating partitions, enclosures, or
load-bearing elements in various structures.
Usage: Residential Buildings Interior/exterior walls
Industrial Sheds Wall cladding, partitioning
Commercial Spaces Storefronts, sidewalls
Villas/Plots Compound/boundary walls

Description: A Precast Beam is a concrete structural element that is cast and cured in a controlled factory environment,
then transported to the site for installation. It serves as a horizontal support for slabs, walls, and loads, often
forming the backbone of precast structural systems like frames, bridges, buildings, and industrial sheds.
Usage: Multi-story Buildings Floor and roof beams
Factories/Warehouses Supporting heavy slab loads
Bridges & Flyovers PSC I-girders or U-girders

Description: A precast slab is a flat, factory-made concrete element used in building floors, roofs, and decks. It is
manufactured off-site under controlled conditions, ensuring high quality and speedier installation at the
construction site. Precast slabs can be solid, hollow-core, waffle, or ribbed, and are often used with precast
beams and columns for modular construction.
A Precast Foundation is a structural base element cast and cured off-site (in a factory) and then transported
to the construction location for quick assembly. It serves the same purpose as conventional foundations but
offers speed, quality control, and minimal site disruption. Precast foundations are commonly used in
modular buildings, warehouses, homes, boundary walls, telecom towers, and temporary structures.
Usage: Modular Housing Fast setup of house or cabin base
Industrial Equipment foundations, shed supports
Telecom Tower and antenna base
Boundary Wall Precast column bases for fencing

Description: A Precast Pile is a long, slender concrete element that is cast and cured off-site, then driven or inserted into
the ground to support structures by transferring loads to deeper, more stable soil layers or bedrock. Precast
piles are widely used in bridges, high-rise buildings, industrial sheds, coastal structures, and poor soil
conditions where shallow foundations aren’t suitable.
Usage: High-Rise Buildings Deep foundation in urban sites
Bridges & Flyovers Abutments and pier foundations
Industrial Structures Heavy load sheds, equipment foundations
Highways Retaining walls, toll booth platforms

Description: A Precast Retaining Wall is a structural concrete wall unit manufactured off-site and installed on location to
retain soil at different elevations, resist lateral earth pressure, and support sloped terrains, roadways,
embankments, and other infrastructure. Compared to cast-in-place walls, precast walls offer faster
installation, cleaner construction, and consistent quality.
Usage: Highways & Railways Embankments, flyover abutments
Infrastructure Projects Bridge approaches, culverts
Residential/Commercial Basement walls, garden terracing
Parks & Landscapes Soil shaping, level creation

Description: A Precast Sandwich Wall Panel is a multi-layered concrete wall element composed of two outer concrete
layers ("wythes") separated by a layer of insulation (typically EPS or PU foam). These panels are
manufactured in a factory and used in energy-efficient buildings, offering structural support + thermal
insulation + architectural finish all in one.
Usage: Commercial Buildings Offices, malls, schools
Residential Housing Villas, apartments, modular homes
Industrial Facilities Warehouses, factories, cold storage
Institutional Buildings Universities, auditoriums, etc.

Description: A Precast Staircase is a factory-cast reinforced concrete stair unit that is transported and installed on site.
These stairs are engineered for accuracy, speed, and clean finishes, eliminating the need for formwork,
shuttering, or on-site curing
Usage: Commercial Buildings Office towers, malls, airports
Residential Complexes Apartments, duplexes, villas
Industrial Facilities Warehouses, factories, control rooms
Infrastructure Projects Metro stations, stadiums, etc.

Description: A Precast Water Tank is a ready-made reinforced concrete structure manufactured in controlled factory
conditions and transported to the site for installation. It is used for storage of potable or non-potable
water, fire reserves, sewage treatment, and rainwater harvesting
These tanks can be underground, above ground, or partially buried.
Usage: Residential Villas, apartment complexes
Commercial Office buildings, malls, hotels
Infrastructure Highways, railway stations
Agriculture Irrigation, animal watering

Description: A Precast Toilet is a factory-made, ready-to-install toilet cabin or block made from reinforced concrete
(RCC) or GRC/FRP shells with precast RCC base and roof. These units are used to provide quick, hygienic,
durable, and permanent sanitation facilities in urban, rural, and infrastructure settings.
Usage: Single Cubicle (1 User) 1 toilet with door, compact footprint
Double Cubicle (2 Users) Two separate compartments
Toilet + Bath Unit With shower area and basin

Description: An Interior Wall Panel is a prefabricated decorative or functional covering used to enhance the aesthetics,insulation, and durability of a wall’s surface.
They can be made from various materials like wood, MDF, PVC, GRC, metal, gypsum, or fabric, and are installed directly over an existing wall or frame.
durable, and permanent sanitation facilities in urban, rural, and infrastructure settings.
Usage: Living rooms, bedrooms, and hallways.
Office reception and meeting rooms.
Hotels, restaurants, and lounges.
Feature/accent walls for aesthetic focus

Description: An Interior Mural is a large-scale artwork or decorative design applied directly to interior walls, ceilings, or panels to create a visually striking focal point.
Usage: Hotels, resorts, and restaurants.
Office lobbies, conference rooms, and reception areas.
Luxury homes, living rooms, and feature walls.
Retail stores and showrooms for brand storytelling.

Description: An Interior Cornice is a decorative moulding installed where the wall meets the ceiling, adding elegance and architectural detail to a room’s interior
Usage: Living rooms, dining areas, and bedrooms.
Hotel lobbies, banquet halls, and restaurants
Office boardrooms and reception areas
Heritage or classical style interiors
